Each cell type is labeled above the cell with un-bolded font. 

Each cell type has an arrow pointing to a blue or red box containing the name of a lymphoma subtype. There is a legend that explains that blue boxes are indolent lymphomas and red boxes are aggressive lymphomas.

scientificBackground:
TRACTION will be the name of our proposed comms plan for a clinical trial in diabetes.
Product name is TRADJENTA (linagliptin) which is a DPP-4 inhibitor
Trial name is CAROLINA: Cardiovascular Outcome Study of Linagliptin Versus Glimepiride in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
The aim of the study is to investigate  long-term impact on CV morbidity and mortality of treatment with TRADJENTA and glimepiride (1st line product) over a period of 6–7 years (ie a long time). This is the first time a DPP-4 inhibitor will be compared to a sulfonylurea in a long-term cardiovascular outcome study.

generalDesc:
This is a video editing project. 
We have filmed a medical expert (Dr Griffiths) talking about a case study on the treatment of poor-risk mRCC. In total,4 takes were recorded during the filming and the client would now like the best sections of each take edited together to produce a final video that can be uploaded to the Pfizer OnDemand website.  The final video will have slides synced to it but rather than having the slides shown alongside the video throughout, it is envisaged that the final video will switch between the view of the medical expert talking and then to showing accompanying case study slides at key points. 
The 4 takes of filming are currently each on separate videos ( video's 5Z8A0497,5Z8A0498,  5Z8A0499 and 5Z8A0500) which are saved on the server (link in the Server location box below). These are very large files, therefore, the client would like an initial edit to be performed,  editing together the best sections of the 4 takes to produce 1 video for the client to review so that they can determine where in the video they would like to show the expert talking, and where they would like to show a slide.
taskDesc: As the 4 takes of filming are very large videos, the client would like an initial edit to be performed,  editing together the best sections of the 4 takes to produce 1 video for the client to review so that they can determine where in the video they would like to show the expert talking, and where they would like to show a slide. The 4 takes (video's 5Z8A0497,5Z8A0498,  5Z8A0499 and 5Z8A0500)  are saved on the server (link in the Server location box below). A cut list has been prepared (attached to the creative request form) to show the sections that need to be kept from each take to be stitched together into one video. The corresponding video code is in red in the cut list and the section to keep has been transcribed and a time code provided.  In addition, as discussed with Daniel, the client would like the background noise on the video to be reduced/removed if possible during the editing process.
brandedOther: The slides that will eventually be synced to the video are already on the Pfizer blue template
lookAndFeel: The final video will move between a view of the medical expert speaking and to case study slides at key points. This final video will be a medical expert talk to be uploaded on the Pfizer OnDemand website.
